definitions.definition: An effort to raise something, such as a weight or one's own body, or to move something heavy.
examples: We gave one more heave and the wall toppled over at last.

definitions.definition: An upward motion; a rising; a swell or distention, as of the breast in difficult breathing, of the waves, of the earth in an earthquake, etc.
A horizontal dislocation in a metallic lode , taking place at an intersection with another lode.
The measure of extent to which a nautical vessel goes up and down in a short period of time.

labels: only used attributively as in "heave line" or "heave horse"
definitions.label_groups: rare , only used attributively as in "heave line" or "heave horse"

definitions.definition: A forceful shot in which the ball follows a high trajectory

main_definition: ( countable ) An effort to raise something, such as a weight or one's own body, or to move something heavy.
secondary_definitions: An upward motion; a rising; a swell or distention, as of the breast in difficult breathing, of the waves, of the earth in an earthquake, etc.
A horizontal dislocation in a metallic lode , taking place at an intersection with another lode.
( nautical ) The measure of extent to which a nautical vessel goes up and down in a short period of time.
( rare , only used attributively as in "heave line" or "heave horse" ) Broken wind in horses .
( cricket ) A forceful shot in which the ball follows a high trajectory
